bluej.codecoverage.pref

Interface PreferenceStore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPreferenceStore

    public interface PreferenceStore
    Represents a class that controls the persistence of User preferences.

    An example of this would be BlueJ with getExtensionProperty and setExtensionProperty.
    Abstracting BlueJ's preference store allows for easier unit testing by just redirecting the preference store.

    Author:
    Ian

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getLocation()
      Location where the preference is stored.
      java.lang.String getPreference(java.lang.String key)
      Looks up a preference using the provided key.

    • Method Detail

      • getPreference

        java.lang.String getPreference(java.lang.String key)
        Looks up a preference using the provided key.

        Parameters:
        key - key of the value to lookup
        Returns:
        String value identified by the key, or null if no value is found.

      • getPreference

        java.lang.String getPreference(java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.String def)
        Looks up a preference using the provided key.

        If value is found the key, then def is returned instead.

        Parameters:
        key - key of the value to look up.
        def - default value to use if no value is found for the key.
        Returns:
        String value identified by the key.

      • setPreference

        void setPreference(java.lang.String key,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Sets the preference identified by the specified key to the specified value.

        This overwrites any existing preference stored using the same key.

        Parameters:
        key - key to identify the preference
        value - value of the preference to save

      • getLocation

        java.lang.String getLocation()
        Location where the preference is stored.

        This is expected to be an absolute path to the directory under which the preferences are stored.

        Returns:
        absolute path to the director of the preferences.
